metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34468 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: An iframe that was not permitted to run scripts could do so if the user clicked on a javascript: link. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102, Firefox ESR < 91.11, Thunderbird < 102, and Thunderbird < 91.11. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34468` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
